briefTitle: Luteal vs Follicular Surgical Oophorectomy and Tamoxifen in Premenopausal Women With Metastatic Hormone Receptor Positive Breast Cancer
officialTitle: Phase III Randomized Study of Luteal Phase vs. Follicular Phase Surgical Oophorectomy and Tamoxifen in Premenopausal Women With Metastatic Hormone Receptor-Positive Breast Cancer
summary: This study will determine if hormone receptor positive premenopausal metastatic breast cancer patients who undergo removal of the ovaries in mid-luteal versus mid-follicular phase have a longer survival.
